DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - 2006 Valinch 12 Year Old - PAC:01
DESCRIPTION:
From Bruichladdich, this Port Charlotte Valinch single cask is an 12 year-old distilled in Islay in 2006, matured in 1st fill pauillac cask #15/139-40.  This is a distillery exclusive release of 448 bottles at 60.4% ABV.  This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 065.

This Japanese whisky from Nikka is a 12 year old. With a majority of malt whisky from Nikkas 2 distilleries in northern Japan - Yoichi and and Miyagikyo - and a grain whisky distilled in a Coffey still, all the elements at the heart of Nikka are brought together in one exceptional whisky.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

The latest edition released in 2020 on 7th of Feb comes this Springbank 12-year-old Cask Strength expression. It matured in 65% Bourbon barrels and 35% Sherry casks. 
Tasting Notes from the distillery itself @ cask strength of 55.3% are as follows -
Nose: Fresh floral notes, white and green wine gums, wood chippings, candied ginger and black liquorice.
Palate: Initially rich & malty; spiced biscuit and salted caramel shortcake with a beautiful oily and chewy mouthfeel. Salted pretzels, Iberico ham and classic Springbank smoke follow.
Finish: The smoke continues alongside sea salt dark chocolate, freshly ground coffee and lemon sherbet.

The latest edition released in 2020 on 7th of Feb comes this Springbank 12-year-old Cask Strength expression. It matured in 65% Bourbon barrels and 35% Sherry casks. 
Tasting Notes from the distillery itself @ cask strength of 55.3% are as follows -

Palate: Initially rich & malty; spiced biscuit and salted caramel shortcake with a beautiful oily and chewy mouthfeel. Salted pretzels, Iberico ham and classic Springbank smoke follow.
Finish: The smoke continues alongside sea salt dark chocolate, freshly ground coffee and lemon sherbet.

Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 602, which was stored on rick number 56. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.
This bottle is registered as number 196.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.
This bottle comes with its own black carry case.

Still part of the core range down in Campletown.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 15...lovely just lovely.

Lumina is part of The Macallan Quest range which was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It features four no-age statement expressions showing off the many, many miles travelled to sources the casks to mature the Speyside whisky. The Lumina expression is made with whisky aged in sherry-seasoned European and American oak casks, as well as hogsheads. While sherry does get a good look-in with this one, it's a much more vanilla and toffee-focussed dram.

This is an old-style old presentation bottling of Glenlivet Archive. The age of the whiskies released under the Archive label has changed over the years. This bottle dates from when it didn't have an age statement. Supposedly only the best casks are selected for the archive and are only used for blending an expression when they are fully mature.
Distilled in 1979, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1997 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%. This is a 1L.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

Kininvie 1991 23 Year Old Batch #003 35cl
Owned by William Grant & Sons this malt is somewhat mysterious. 
A travel retail exclusive which was matured in both European Sherry and American Oak Casks.

An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.
Voted distillery of the year in 2001 by Malt Advocate and this malt took home the gold from Stockholm Whisky festival in 2001.

Bottled in 2014, this is the 1998 vintage of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition. This double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks. A whisky that never disappoints.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was distilled in 2002 and then poured into first-fill ex-bourbon barrels to age until it was bottled in 2017. It was bottled at 43% ABV.

Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old from the 1980s, this is an old-style bottling from Islay.
With milder tones, this would be an ideal introduction to the Islay malts.
The Chivas Brothers Royal Salute was bottled 21 years of age, in a sapphire flagon.

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

This is the second edition of the Dalmore Cigar Malts as the original Dalmore Cigar Malt was discontinued in mid-2009.  It has since been relaunched in an eye-catching red box. The body, structure and character of this Dalmore Cigar Malt is said to be the perfect complement to a fine cigar.

Looking great in its new packaging wouldnt you agree? The Arran 18 has undergone a bit of rebranding in 2019. However, Aaran fans, please dont worry, the whisky that is inclosed within still remains the same. 
Handpicked from the island's warehouses sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #010
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
Batch #10 was bottled at 58.6% in Jan 18.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.
This discontinued Longmorn was bottled after being matured in oak casks for 15 years in the heart of the Scottish Highands.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was distilled in 2002 and then poured into first-fill ex-bourbon barrels to age until it was bottled in 2017. It was bottled at 43% ABV.

Laphroaig release for Feis Ile 2018 was double matured in an ex-bourbon casks then finished in Fino casks.
If you have not been to the Feis...what are you waiting for?

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Càirdeas Triple Wood - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has had a special triple maturation; first matured in ex-bourbon barrels, then in quarter casks and finally in European oak casks which previously held oloroso sherry.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.

Still part of the core range down in Campletown, just slightly older packaging.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 15...lovely just lovely.

Batch #10 was bottled at 58.6% in Jan 18.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 15 Year Old - Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in refill and first fill sherry casks comes this 15 Year old Mortlach from G&M.
This is part of what is now known as the Gordon & MacPhail Distillery Labels series, which replicates the livery the Elgin-based bottlers used in the mid-20th century when they produced the only official bottlings (under license) for many distilleries like this.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

This 15 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for fifteen years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  It is 'a rich straw whisky' with notes of cinnamon, rich chocolate and dried fruits.  This bottle is an import.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle released by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2018 and includes double matured Laphroaig from ex-bourbon barrels then Fino Sherry Casks. These special casks have been stored in Warehouse 8 and 10.
It was bottled at 51.8% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 15 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
A Speyside classic from Linkwood / Gordon Macphail. 
Bottled after 15 years of maturation, these labels are exclusive to G&M. This series is all about how the distillers only allowed official bottlings. However, this has now changed with time and what a great job G&M have made!

This 10 year old single malt is a great example of some of Fettercairns best whisky, this is an older discontinued botting.  Fettercairn, owned by Whyte and Mackay distillers, is a Highland distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.
This Old Pulteney single malt is a 2006 vintage, matured in first-fill American oak bourbon barrels. The no age statement whisky was bottled in 2017 at 46% ABV.

Milsean was the seventh release in Glenmorangie's Private Edition series. It was finished for two-and-a-half years in 154 toasted ex-Portuguese-red-wine barriques. This highland malt is sweet with notes of tropical fruit and lemon sherbet, backed up with some ginger spice.
'Milsean' is Gaelic for 'sweet things.'

This is Glenmorangie Astar was originally released in 2008 but was sadly discontinued in 2012 due to a lack of the very specific casks used to create it.  'Astar' is Gaelic for ‘journey’ - in reference to journey to perfection that Glenmorangie on in their search for the perfect casks to mature whisky.

Time has mellowed but not tamed this powerful 18 year old Talisker, made beside Loch Harport in the shadow of the Cuillin range. A rich, sweet nose introduces familiar, smoky maritime aromas. Full-bodied, this smooth malt open sweetly, then becomes more assertive, with a whiff of smoke. It has an unmistakeable, richly warming finish, more subtle here than in the 10 year old.

A Macallan independently bottled by the Hart Brothers which was distilled at Easter Elchies house on the banks of the Spey in February 1998.
Bottled 14 Years later in December 2012 at cask strength.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.
Glenmorangie Bacalta is s a single malt that is the eight release from the Private Edition collection. Matured in ex-bourbon casks and extra matured in former malmsey maderia wine casks.

Bottled in 2016, this is the Millenium 2000 vintage of Lagavulin's Distillers Edition. This double-matured Lagavulin has had a finishing period in sweet, sticky Pedro Ximénez sherry casks.
A whisky that never disappoints, this bottle is also much more special because it celebrates the 200th anniverasy of the distillery.
Glenmorangie have released Allta as 10th release as part of the Private Edition. Allta has been created with their own wild yeast.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

The distillery is said to be the birthplace of distilling on Islay. The rich and intenseness of the flavours infuse the senses with delight.
A travel exclusive from the Islay company, in Port Ellen Isle of Islay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 15 Year Old - The Renaissance Chapter 3
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Garioch Chapter 3 of 4 is This 17 year old and part of a limited release of The Renaissance Series.
Each bottle is said to tell a different part of the start-up of the once closed distillery back in 1997.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

DESCRIPTION:

This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

DESCRIPTION:

This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.
This 2005-vintage Aultmore was matured in a single refill bourbon barrel for 13 years. It was bottled in February 2019 by Gordon & MacPhail for the Connoisseurs Choice series.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

This single cask by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society was distilled on the 5th Oct 2006 and bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.4% at 9 years old. Matured in a refill ex-bourbon barrel, this edition has been named Ploughman's on the beach.

Founded in 1988 by Brian and Andrew Symington, the Signatory collection is well known for cask strength expressions and unchilled bottlings. It is still one of the leading and largest independent whisky bottlers in the world. At the time of writing this, they even own Edradour distillery after purchasing it from Pernod Ricard in 2002.
Here we have a selection of their miniature collection from the Campbeltown, Islands and the Lowlands.
Glen Scotia - 1990 - 43% @ 50ml
Ledaig - 1993 - 43% @50ml
Bladnoch - 1988 - 43% @ 50ml
Rosebank - 1990 - 43% @50ml
This is said to be a balanced 18 Year Old - time has tamed the peatiness, with the raw Islay character being tempered by a robust oak influence.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 62. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

A 12 year old Glenfiddich with a twist - the malted barley is dried using peat to produce a more characterful, smoky flavour - its name “Caoran” is from the Gaelic for Peat Ember.  Although a resounding success since its launch, this is a discontinued bottling.
This is an increasingly rare bottling of Old Parr 12 Year Old.  This is a 1L bottling. It is named after Thomas Parr.

This single cask by the Scotch Malt Whisky Society is a 12-year-old Bunnahabhain. This is one of just 311 bottles produced. Matured in a 2nd fill hogshead/ex-bourbon cask and bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.8%, it is said to be a 'warm, fuzzy feeling' dram!

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 62. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 62. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

inspired by and named after the Tarlogie Spring, which has served as the sole water source for Glenmorangie since 1843. Its unique, mineral-rich waters lets them create their signature fragrant house style.
Aged in virgin oak as well as ex-bourbon casks, this single malt displays the sweet purity of the Tarlogie Spring.
Initially launched exclusively in global travel retail, Brodir is aged initially in ex-bourbon barrels, before being finished in European oak ex-ruby port casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Càirdeas Triple Wood - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has had a special triple maturation; first matured in ex-bourbon barrels, then in quarter casks and finally in European oak casks which previously held oloroso sherry.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in March 19.

Laphroaig Lore is said to be the richest ever Laphroaig made from malt aged from 7 to 21 years. This edition was inspired and named after the skills passed down over the generations, this permanent addition to the range is matured in a combination of specially selected casks including first-fill Sherry butts and quarter casks.
This whisky was also named 2019 Best No Age Statement Scotch by Jim Murray’s Whisky Bible.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 15 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in refill and first fill sherry casks comes this 15 Year old Mortlach from G&M.
This is part of what is now known as the Gordon & MacPhail Distillery Labels series, which replicates the livery the Elgin-based bottlers used in the mid-20th century when they produced the only official bottlings (under license) for many distilleries like this.

Distilled in 2004 just outside the town of Alness in the highlands, this Dalmore has been matured 10 years in American white oak bourbon barrels.
Whisky auction fans will be clambering...
An older bottle of Jameson 12 Year Old this special reserve is a full bodied pot still character Irish whisky, gently matured in sherry wood.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.
This bottle comes with its own black carry case.

Hidden deep in the east Highland hills, GlenDronach Distillery have been perfecting this Batch 8 from the series of Cask Strength. 
This bottle is richly sherried and has been matured in the finest pedro ximenez and oloroso sherry casks. The whisky has been bottled at natural cask strength at 61% ABV.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

The Macallan Quest was originally released for the Travel Retail market.  It was designed to pay homage to the journey taken by The Macallan to source the best oak across over 20,000 miles.  It is made from a combination of four varieties of cask - bourbon casks, sherry-seasoned European oak casks, sherry-seasoned American oak casks, and hogsheads. The Quest packaging has a blue sky which is said to symbolise 'the start of the journey where the world is a canvas and the sky is the limit' for Macallan.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

A limited release which was only made available at the Kilchoman Distillery Shop during Feis Ile 2016. If you have not been to Islay or Feis...its about time you did! One of the younger distilleries on the island, however, Kilchoman is certainly holding its own! This single cask was finished in a Sauternes. Distilled in 2012 and bottled at 58% in 2017.
Cask Number 209/2012.

From J&B's, A vintage bottling from the Speyside distillery, Knockando.
Bottled in 1995 and distilled in 1980.

This is a very nicely presented bottle of 21-year-old blended whisky from Whyte & Mackay, which is believed to be produced in the 1980's. The bottle comes with a metallic tag that hangs from the neck of the decanter. It also comes in a beautiful silky lined presentation box.

This is a limited edition bottling of Glenmorangie which is to raise awareness for the conservation of the Dornoch Firth, Glenmorangie has partnered with the Marnie Conservation Society - working together to perserve this precious waterway.
A proportion of this whisky has been extra matured or 'finished' in Amontillado sherry butts.

Distilled in 2009 from the Swedish distillery, this sherry cask expression was later bottled in 2014.
A very rare bottle not seen often at auction.

The massive brand comes from Spain and this bottling is at the top of their range.
It certainly deserves recognition even over here in the UK.
Havent tried it, now is your time...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 200th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Gold Label - The Centenary Blend
DESCRIPTION: This is a blend is a 15 year old Centenary blend. This inspired blend of rare aged whisky has full aroma, smooth rich character and a uniquely long finish, it was created by Sir Alexander Walker in 1920 to celebrate the founding of the company by John Walker 100 years before.

The Platinum Label is a relatively new addition to the Johnnie Walker collection. 
Originally released for travel retail, the Platinum Label (the first new 'colour' to be introduced into the Johnnie Walker range for years).

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1988 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch D.SK.312

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold - Double Cask - 2019 Special Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Special Edition - the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars, has inspired the distinctive design of this special edition gift box. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

This single cask Craigellachie was distilled in May 2006 and was bottled in February 2019 at 12 Years Old by Hunter Laing & Company Ltd, for their Old Malt Cask range.   This is one of 285 from sherry butt #HL15806. Bottled at 50% ABV.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

Aldi, the supermarket chain, produced this mystery 24-year-old whisky.
Very reasonably priced it quickly sold. It is not the only supermarket chain that their whisky has ranked highly...
10 points if you can name another!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 15 Year Old - Select Cask Reserve
DESCRIPTION: A 15 year old is a select cask reserve which has been distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery. It has been matured hand-selected traditional oak casks.

Cotswolds Single Malt Whisky is the first whisky ever distilled in the Cotswolds. They use 100% locally grown, floor-malted barley and mature the whisky in first-fill ex-Bourbon barrels and reconditioned red wine casks. Rich, fruity and sippable with notes of honey, Seville orange marmalade and dark red fruits.

Located in Thurso, this is the Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland. Named after a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn opened in 2013. 
This is the 2018 Christmas release and bears the verse of "Winter Time" by Robert Louis Stevenson on the label.

This is the 7th release in the GlenDronach Cask Strength series of batched release. The Master Blender has selected casks to give the ideal marriage of Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry. Bottled at 57.9%.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.
This Arran single malt early bottling of no age statement Arran single malt, made available only to the initial bondholders - the investors in Arran Distillery, making it very rare!
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

The Bowmore Darkest has been matured in Bourbon casks initially, but the final three years the single malt spent in Oloroso sherry casks gives the whisky its rich, deep colour.  This 15 year old was bottled at 43% abv.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 9 Year Old - Game of Thrones - House Lannister
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo collaborated with HBO to release a limited-edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
This 9-year-old Islay single malt from Lagavulin represents the House Lannister - one of the richest and oldest dynasties in the Seven Kingdoms. This 9 year old was matured exclusively in first-fill ex-bourbon casks.

This is an iconic bottle of Rock Rose Rock Rose Gin, made at the Dunnet Bay Distillery in Caithness, Scotland.
Distilled in 2014, this is a numbered bottle from Batch 1 - the first bacth produced by the distillery.
It features an alluring botanical selection including locally harvested Rhodiola Rosea, Rowan Berries, Sea Buckthorn, Blaeberries, Verbena, Coriander Seed, Cardamom and Juniper from two different countries - Italy and Bulgaria. They use a traditional copper pot still - named Elizabeth.
This is bottle 389.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

Cragganmore Distillers Edition, released in 2003, this dram was finished in Port casks.
CggD-6555.

A rare old vintage bottling of the Singleton (when it was still from Auchroisk).
This is a 70cl bottle.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

Another superb cask-finished whisky from Glenmorangie as part of their Legends range, this time using Amontillado sherry casks. This offering was previously only available at travel retail, though luckily a few bottles have made it onto our shelves. Glenmorangie the Tayne takes its inspiration from the legend of a Spanish man-o’-war ship that was wrecked off the coast close to the distillery. The whisky seeks to recreate the profile of a “Spanish treasure”. This whisky takes Glenmorangie’s classic floral, biscuity flavours, and adds another layer of sherried complexity. Amontillado is a type of sherry typified as being darker than Fino but lighter than Oloroso, with an excellent balance between the dry and sweet characteristics of both sherries.
It was, of course, immortalised by Edgar Allen Poe in his classic gothic short story, The Cask of Amontillado. There are no horror stories here however, with Glenmorangie the Tayne being a superb whisky, with excellent, sophisticated flavours of dry wine, almonds and honey. This whisky is bottled at 43%, and in a litre size.

This Dalmore 12 year old, is one of the older style bottlings.  This presentation of the Dalmore 12 is no longer available from the distillery. 
Dalmore 12 is aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
Using water from the river Alness the Dalmore distillery has produced some really majestic whisky since 1839.
This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

Glenmorangie thoughts and the public opinion on this bottle is somewhat divided. It is an official 'crowd-sourced' whisky.
The whisky characteristics were decided by Glenmorangie's 'Cask Masters' and it was matured in ex-bourbon wood before being finished in Manzanilla casks.

Founded in 1988 by Brian and Andrew Symington, the Signatory collection is well known for cask strength expressions and unchilled bottlings. It is still one of the leading and largest independent whisky bottlers in the world. At the time of writing this, they even own Edradour distillery after purchasing it from Pernod Ricard in 2002.
Here we have a selection of their miniature collection from the Orkney.
Highland Park - 1977 - 43% @ 50ml
Scapa - 1980 - 43% @50ml
Scapa - 1989 - 43% @ 50ml

Founded in 1988 by Brian and Andrew Symington, the Signatory collection is well known for cask strength expressions and unchilled bottlings. It is still one of the leading and largest independent whisky bottlers in the world. At the time of writing this, they even own Edradour distillery after purchasing it from Pernod Ricard in 2002.

Littlemill - 1990 - 43% @ 50ml
Rosebank - 1989 - 43% @50m
Bladnoch - 1987 - 43% @ 50ml

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 200th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

This is a limited edition release from Glenfiddich. The Original is based on Hamish Robertson's 1963 Straight Malt recipe, considered by many to be the world's first single malt.  Presented in a bold premium black tin, this is a non-age statement single malt whisky bottled at 40% abv.

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.

This single malt from the Tamdhu Distillery has no age statement. It has been suggested that this bottling was released in the late 80’s before Tamdhu became one of Edrington’s key sherry wood supplying distilleries.

This Glenkinchie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1989 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch G/277-7-D

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

This is travel retail exclusive 35cl is a a celebration of the bicentennial year Laphroaig. and it is a fitting tribute indeed, a tempting nose leading you to a sweet and minty expression where the island’s famous barley is evident

Tusail is the sixth entry in Glenmorangie's Private Collection.  Made using traditionally floor-malted Maris Otter barley, this is an old-fashioned whisky backed up by Glenmorangie's modern approach to whisky-making.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenturret - 16 Year Old - Fly's Masters Edition
DESCRIPTION: A special release celebrating a photo from 1905 discovered at Glenturret that shows the 16 still men and Fly the dog. Fly's 16 Masters Edition is a limited release of 1,740 bottles first made available on World Whisky Day 2016.

Strathisla 12 Year Old is a Chivas malt. This malt is finished in ex-sherry barrels and is a highly commended fruity and sherry-rich Speyside single malt. In 2013 it had its packaging revamped to give it a fresh look.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 8 Year Old - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: Old Pulteney is a Highland malt from the North of Scotland. This 8 year old from was matured in refill Bourbon barrels then bottled by Gordon and MacPhail.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 15 Year Old - French Oak Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old expression from The Glenlivet, was matured in French Limousin Oak casks. Limousin Oak is a popular choice for the maturation of Cognac.  Glenlivet were one of the first to use French oak for making whisky, a technique that has since been imitated the world over.

Created and released on the travel retail market this Bowmore 100 Degrees Proof is non chill-filtered.
What more could you ask for, I mean its a 1L and bottled at cask-strength 57.1%...bid away!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - Winters Frost - Game of Thrones - House of Stark
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo have collaborated with HBO to release a limited edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
The lords of House Stark ruled as King in the North for generations, in the vast cold expanse of the northern lands of Westeros. The Stark's resilience, strength and ability to thrive in the most intense situations are greatly shaped by Winterfell's frigid temperatures. Like House Stark, Dalwhinnie is made in one of the highest and coldest distilleries in Scotland, and its extreme conditions are responsible for shaping its signature flavour.
Matured in 100% ex-bourbon casks, this Highland single malt has a uniquely floral, honeyed character. The palate has rich manuka honey and fresh figs, developing into malt balls before a rich fruit cake finish.
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.

Strathisla 12 Year Old is a Chivas malt. This malt is finished in ex-sherry barrels and is a highly commended fruity and sherry-rich Speyside single malt. In 2013 it had its packaging revamped to give it a fresh look.

Special reserve scotch malt whisky - raise a glass to rise now and be a nation again. 
This is a blend of the finest Malt and grain whiskies specially selected from mature stocks.

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Moray - 15 Year Old Black Watch Highland Regiment
DESCRIPTION: 15 year old Glen Moray is contained within this lovely presentation tin which represents the Black Watch edition of the Highland Regiment.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

This 5-year-old Campbeltown blended malt whisky from Thompson Brothers was matured in a refill hogshead. The palate offers notes of chamomile, citrus and apple.
Thompson Bros - Named after Philip and Simon Thompson, the brothers behind the Dornoch Distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 200th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

This is Scotch Malt Whisky Society Single Cask No. 9.45.  It is an 11-year-old single malt from Glen Grant distillery.  Matured in a refill hogshead/ex-bourbon cask. It was bottled at the cask strength of 58.9% abv.

Macallan Gold was first introduced in 2012 as part of the distillery's 1824 range of non-age statement expressions, before being renamed Macallan Gold Double Cask in 2018 as part of the new core range. Matured in a combination of first fill and refill American oak and European oak sherry casks to create an incredibly smooth and rich single malt. Soft gold in colour, this is the lightest expression of the Macallan range, but still packed with typical Speyside Macallan flavours.

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 12 Year Old - Nectar D'or - Sauturnes Cask
DESCRIPTION: Nectar D'Or - Sauternes cask finish was first aged for 12 years in American oak bourbon casks and after finished rare Sauternes casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 12 Year Old - Nectar D'or - Sauturnes Cask
DESCRIPTION: Nectar D'Or - Sauternes cask finish was first aged for 12 years in American oak bourbon casks and after finished rare Sauternes casks.
An iconic old-style 70cl bottling of Glenmorangie 10 Year old with classic presentation tin.

The Bowmore Darkest has been matured in Bourbon casks initially, but the final three years the single malt spent in Oloroso sherry casks gives the whisky its rich, deep colour.  This 15 year old was bottled at 43% abv.

Aberlour Casg Annamh - 'Rare Cask' in Gaelic -  sherried release from Aberlour, Triple matured in European oak ex-sherry, American oak ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, this is a bold, flavoursome and exceptionally balanced whisky. It is non chill-filtered and produced in small batches - this bottling is part of Batch 2.
A cask strength bottling of Ardmore by Gordon and Macphail distilled in 1990.  Matured in refill bourbon barrels #12277, #12278.  It was bottled in November 2003 at the natural cask strength of55.8%.

Released in 2019, this non-age stated Glengoyne is the first of the Legacy Series.
Completely free of peat this bottling features a 'heart' of first-fill European oak Oloroso sherry casks.

10,000 bottles were produced of this Kilchoman Autumn 2009 release which was only the second release from the distillery.
3 years in bourbon casks and finished in Oloroso sherry casks. Just to top it off a 3 year old refill bourbon barrel was added to the vatting.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

Benromach Peat Smoke was distilled in 2008.
It's part of a small number of batches, that include peat, from the Speyside distillery.
47ppm of peat and notes of liquorice, orange or grapefruit.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Ness of Brodgar's Legacy
DESCRIPTION: This is a special edition of Highland Park 12 Year Old, released to support the work and ambitions of the Ness of Brodgar Trust in one of the world’s most important ongoing archaeological excavations, situated in the Heart of Neolithic Orkney World Heritage Site.  This release is part of Highland Park's Orkney Legacy series and this is one of just 5,000 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 7 Year Old - Giovinetti Selection 1990s (5cl) (& glass)
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 5cl bottling of a hard to find 7 Year Old Armando Giovinetti Special Selection from the 1990s. This bottling was specially produced for Giovinetti and Figli, the Italian wine and spirits company.
Armando Giovinetti, famous among the whisky community, has often been known as the main link between Scotland and Itlay long-lasting history when it comes to single malts.
Sara Midda artistic flair has been used on the label and was painted during a visit to the distillery. Both people related to the distillery at this time.

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

Bottled in 2015 this Benriach is a 12-Year-Old matured in Sherry Wood Pre-2018.
Fully matured in Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks.  
This BenRiach was the winner of the '12YO and under' category in the 2014 Spirit of Speyside Whisky Festival.
A nose of dark chocolate, sultanas and rich spices.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cardhu Gold Reserve - Game of Thrones - House Targaryen
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Cardhu Gold Reserve 'House Targaryen' is part of the Game of Thrones collection by Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - Winters Frost - Game of Thrones - House of Stark
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo have collaborated with HBO to release a limited edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
The lords of House Stark ruled as King in the North for generations, in the vast cold expanse of the northern lands of Westeros. The Stark's resilience, strength and ability to thrive in the most intense situations are greatly shaped by Winterfell's frigid temperatures. Like House Stark, Dalwhinnie is made in one of the highest and coldest distilleries in Scotland, and its extreme conditions are responsible for shaping its signature flavour.
Matured in 100% ex-bourbon casks, this Highland single malt has a uniquely floral, honeyed character. The palate has rich manuka honey and fresh figs, developing into malt balls before a rich fruit cake finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Glendullan - Game of Thrones - House of Tully
DESCRIPTION: The Singleton Glendullan Reserve hails from Dufftown distillery. Glendullan is located on the banks of the River Fiddich, so it has been cleverly paired with House Tully at Riverrun, which is in the region known as The Riverlands. This single malt Scotch whisky is decorated with a jumping trout - the sigil of House Tully.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 13 Year Old - Gordon & Macphail
DESCRIPTION:
This is an independently bottled Caol Ila 13 Year Old by Gordon & MacPhail, released as part of a their "Discovery" range.
It was introduced in 2018.  The embossed glass certainly adds to its expensive feel.

A special bottling of malt whiskies from 27 of Diageo's distilleries.  This blend was been produced to commemorate the opening of Diageo's 28th distillery, Roseisle. Roseisle Distillery was officially opened on October 11th 2010.
 
This is bottle number 1876.
Distilled in 1991, this Knockando single malt was matured for 12 years and bottled at 43%.
This lot is now discontinued it is a 12 year old light style whisky from Fettercairn.

An older official bottling of Royal Brackla Single Malt Whisky.
The Highland distillery is not very well known among the general public.  It has only come into the spotlight recently with a new core range being released.

This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.
Nectar d'Or is a 12 year old whisky which was first aged in American oak bourbon casks and after finished rare Sauternes casks.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.
This Glentauchers 15 Year Old was bottled at 46%.  It was released at the end of the 1990s when the distillery was still owned by Allied Domecq.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
Comes with an Ardbeg branded tasting glass.
